Class Fire

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fire

  • public class Fire
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an animated fire with (x,y) coordinate and can either be extinguished/not extinguished
    Version:
    5/13/19
    Author:
    Ashwini Suriyaprakash

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Fire(double x, double y)
      Creates a Fire object that is not extinguished

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fire

        public Fire(double x,
            double y)
        Creates a Fire object that is not extinguished
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the fire's center
        y - y coordinate of the fire's center

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        Loads flame and smoke images
        Parameters:
        drawer - PApplet needed for the setup

      • shift

        public void shift(double offsetX,
                  double offsetY)
        Shifts the Fire's location
        Parameters:
        offsetX - amount in the x direction the fire should be shifted by
        offsetY - amount in the y direction the fire should be shifted by

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        Draws the Fire object on a PApplet
        Parameters:
        drawer - PApplet on which Fire object is drawn

      • extinguish

        public void extinguish()
        Extinguishes the fire

      • isHitByWaterSpray

        public boolean isHitByWaterSpray(WaterSpray spray)
        Checks for collision between Fire and a WaterSpray object
        Parameters:
        spray - WaterSpray object to check for collision with
        Returns:
        true if this Fire was hit by WaterSpray, otherwise false
